page.title: 05PHYSICAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: The western part of our D block is situated on the eastern slopes of {Arthur's Seat,}the remains of an {extinct volcano.}From the highest point on these slopes ( 150 metres ) it is possible to view the entire block. The land slopes down fairly steeply at first but then levels out in a{narrow coastal plain. Cultivation {terraces}are clearly visible on the slopes of Arthur's Seat. The{Figgate Burn}flows NE through the area while in the south the{Brunstane {Burn}flows E to the Firth of Forth. Both valleys are wooded for long stretches. Other major drainage features include{Duddingston Loch, {Dunsapie Loch}and the{Figgate Pond. From the viewpoint it is possible to see across the{Forth Estuary}to{Fife, to the{Bass Rock}(some 25 miles away), and SE to the{Lammermuir Hills.
